Name: Osiris Canopus
Description: This bronze Osiris Canopus, which probably dates from the Roman Period, is shaped like a vase with a human head wearing the nemes headdress. The uppermost part of the body is decorated with a chest ornament shaped like a naos, flanked by two birds whose heads have not been finished. Underneath this motif is a falcon with outspread wings; on his head is a sun disk and two uraei. The function of this type of vase is very unclear.
